messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: porn sites
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/3/2001 10:23:15 AM Central Daylight Time, pamhartley@mindspring.com writes:  I wonder, what is the point. Money. New customers. Luring
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/3/2001 10:23:15 AM Central Daylight Time,
pamhartley@... writes:

<< > I wonder, what is the point.


Money. New customers. Luring the ones who are manfully (said Pam, no doubt
sexistly <g>) or lazily avoiding going SEARCHING for porn, but will click if
it falls in their, er, laps. >>


I suppose this it true. It it so annoying.

Candy

messages.subject: Re: porn sites
messages.msgSnippet: ... Money. New customers. Luring the ones who are manfully (said Pam, no doubt sexistly ) or lazily avoiding going SEARCHING for porn, but will click if it
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1287
>Date: Sun, Jun 3, 2001, 1:58 AM
>

> I wonder, what is the point.


Money. New customers. Luring the ones who are manfully (said Pam, no doubt
sexistly <g>) or lazily avoiding going SEARCHING for porn, but will click if
it falls in their, er, laps.

The same reason cigarette companies (and milk companies, and baby toy and
liquor and dog training and...) pay for advertising. It works.

Pam, resigned to deleting spam e-mail
